page.title: 01WICHENFORD
page.content: {Wichenford}is a small village of 483 people about 7 miles out of Worcester. {Castle Hill}was the village centre, but{Council Houses}were built to the north after the war, and the village moved to its present site. The main land-holder,{Colonel Britten lives at{Wichenford Court,}a manor dating back to the 13th century. This is a farming area, presenting a peaceful rural scene of gentle hills, lush fields, coppices, and orchards. The{village}lost its school in 1970 when the younger population fell, and today the building houses a day- centre for the aged and handicapped. {St Laurence Church}now shares a vicar; and the only shops are a{Post Office, a{Bakery}and the{Pub. Bounded by{Bulmers' orchards, Laughern {Hill, Kenswick Manor and fruit fields, it is a beautiful, quietly busy area.
